title: NumPy Dataset: Temperature Conversion
story: You have temperature readings in Celsius. Convert them all to Fahrenheit using vectorized operations (no loops!).
instructions: Use the provided temperatures_celsius.csv dataset. Load temperatures, convert to Fahrenheit using formula F = C * 9/5 + 32, and print the converted array.
starterCode:
import numpy as np

# Load dataset (provided as CSV)
temps_c = np.array([0, 10, 20, 30, 100])

# Convert to Fahrenheit (vectorized)
temps_f = temps_c * 9/5 + 32
print(temps_f)
solutionHidden:
import numpy as np

temps_c = np.array([0, 10, 20, 30, 100])
temps_f = temps_c * 9/5 + 32
print(temps_f)

hints.text: Use broadcasting: temps_c * 9/5 + 32 applies to all elements at once.
No loops needed! NumPy operations are vectorized automatically.
